intro: Epipactis latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved helleborine, is a perennial orchid native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, greenish-yellow flowers with distinctive spurred petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wet meadows. It has a complex root system and is known for its ability to thrive in humid conditions. Epipactis latifolia is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora.
